definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor

sentences.english: The children finally nagged the nurse into taking them to the zoo.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们终于缠得保姆答应带他们去动物园了。
他给临时来照看孩子的保姆付了钱。

sentences.english: Because of the baby-sitting function, they will not empty the schools.
sentences.chinese: 因为临时保姆的职能，学校始终都会有学生。

sentences.english: If you have kids then of course you have to make arrangements with a babysitter.
sentences.chinese: 但要是你有小孩，那么你当然需要和保姆安排一下。

sentences.english: It can even recommend private holiday nannies and babysitters in Majorca.
sentences.chinese: 它甚至为你推荐马略卡岛的私人度假保姆和临时奶妈。

sentences.english: I think it would be better to have a good babysitter here. But I don't know who to ask.
sentences.chinese: 找个临时保姆在这里比较好，可是我不知道找谁。

sentences.english: When she got everything done, she would chat with Ye’s wife, Mei Jing. Mei felt Hong was a really good nurse.
sentences.chinese: 闲下来时，就同梅婧聊天，梅婧觉得这个保姆真不错。

sentences.english: Then she came to Ye’s house as a nurse.
sentences.chinese: 便主动来叶城家当保姆。
保姆怜爱地抚摸着孩子。

sentences.english: Perhaps it's better to be a well-paid nanny than an attention-starved rich kid.
sentences.chinese: 也许做一个高薪保姆比做缺乏关心的有钱小孩要好。

sentences.english: But Nurse was dead and Yezzan too sick to name a successor.
sentences.chinese: 但是但是保姆死了而耶赞病到没法指定一个接替者。

sentences.english: I smoked when they were sleeping or when they were with the babysitter.
sentences.chinese: 在他们睡觉或者和保姆在一起的时候我才会抽。

sentences.english: Zhu Baiyong allows a flower to become nurse please.
The nurse calmed the little boy down by giving him some candy.
sentences.chinese: 保姆给那个小男孩一些糖果，使他安静下来了。

sentences.english: Many kiss the baby for the nurse's sake.
sentences.chinese: 多少人亲孩子脸，只为一博保姆欢。

sentences.english: While the mother was abroad, the baby was dealt fairly well by the babysitter.
sentences.chinese: 当妈妈出国时，孩子得到了保姆的精心照料。

definition: woman hired to take care of a newborn child and its mother in the month after childbirth
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
